description:
Some of the original files are needed to run the game, as well as some minor tweaking. Aside from occasional crashes, everything works perfectly. I wish the developers included the sound setup as well.
ROTT might not be free software, but I'm glad to see it on GNU/Linux.

This seemed like a fun game, but I encountered a strange error on startup. I know this is not how you report errors, but while I'm here, I might as well tell the error in case a developer sees it and makes sense of it.

In a window titled "ROTT": W_InitFiles: One or more of the required ROTT 1.3 data files could not be found. Please read the README.Debian file.

I'm running Ubuntu 18.04.3 LTS on a Dell OptiPlex 7010.
summary: Encountered an error on first startup

description:
This package cointains only the engine files itself and is useless without the game data. There are no instructions where the game data needs to be located and in what format. The website offers no help either.
Im sure I would figure it out and get it to run eventually, but I just cant waste so much time to play an antique game...
summary: Unusable due to missing game files and total lack of documentation

description: No funciona el paquete, no queda claro cuales otros paquetes debería descargar
Je ne trouve pas l'application necessaire pour jouer

не работает!

$ sudo su
$ apt-get install rott unzip
$ mkdir -p /usr/share/games/rott/
$ cd /usr/share/games/rott/
$ wget ftp://ftp.3drealms.com/share/1rott13.zip
$ unzip 1rott13.zip
$ unzip ROTTSW13.SHR
$ exit
$ rott
